text: Mohammed Ali Salim (1935 - 28 January 2022) was a Libyan politician. He was the Acting Chairman of the General National Congress of Libya. He was the oldest member of Libya's first democratically elected legislature until Mohamed Yousef el-Magariaf was appointed permanent chair. In 2012, he was the President of the General National Congress of Libya. Salim died in Tunisia on 28 January 2022, at the age of 87. ==References== Category:1935 births Category:Heads of state of Libya Category:2022 deaths
title: Mohammed Ali Salim
